param.span: 要检查反序列化能力的 。

span.span: The to check for the ability to deserialize.
The property value.

summary.span: 确定是否能够在 属性设置为 时反序列化指定的 。

span.span: Determines whether the specified can be deserialized with the property set to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法来确定是否可以将指定的类型反序列化时属性设置为`Low`。Use this method to determine whether a specified type can be deserialized when the property is set to `Low`. .NET framework 远程处理提供了两个级别的自动反序列化和。.NET Framework remoting provides two levels of automatic deserialization, and . 帮助防止反序列化仅与最基本的远程处理功能相关联的类型反序列化攻击。 helps protect against deserialization attacks by deserializing only the types associated with the most basic remoting functionality. 反序列化级别支持对远程处理在各种情况下支持的所有类型进行自动反序列化。The deserialization level supports automatic deserialization of all types that remoting supports in all situations. 详细了解.net Framework 远程处理类型并支持，请参阅[.NET Framework 远程处理中的自动反序列化](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/5dxse167(v=vs.100))。For more information about the.NET Framework remoting types that and support, see [Automatic Deserialization in .NET Framework Remoting](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/5dxse167(v=vs.100)). ## Examples 此示例演示如何使用类来序列化或反序列化的对象的基类中不实现但派生的类。This example shows how to use the class to serialize or deserialize an object where the base class does not implement but the derived class does. [!code-cpp[FormatterServices#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FormatterServices/cpp/FormatterServices.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[FormatterServices#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FormatterServices/CS/FormatterServices.cs#1)]

exception.span: 参数是高级类型，不能在 属性设置为 时被反序列化。

span.span: The parameter is an advanced type and cannot be deserialized when the property is set to .

related.span: .NET Framework 远程处理中的自动反序列化

span.span: Automatic Deserialization in .NET Framework Remoting

summary.span: 从指定对象提取数据并将其以对象数组的形式返回。

span.span: Extracts the data from the specified object and returns it as an array of objects.

returns.span: 的数组，它包含存储在 中并与 关联的数据。

span.span: An array of that contains data stored in and associated with .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 每个提供成员`members`数组方法提取与关联的值`obj`对象，并将其返回。For each supplied member of the `members` array the method extracts the value associated with the `obj` object, and returns it. 返回数组的长度是相同的长度`members`数组。The length of the returned array is the same as the length of the `members` array. ## Examples 下面的示例创建的 Book 类实例，并在实例上设置字段值。The following example creates an instance of a Book class and sets field values on the instance. 然后，代码获取类型信息使用方法。The code then gets the type information using the method. 代码的实例数据复制到对象数组使用方法。The code copies the instance data into an object array using the method. 使用创建类的新未初始化的实例方法。A new uninitialized instance of the class is created using the method. 最后，第一个实例中的数据复制到第二个实例使用方法。Finally, the data from the first instance is copied into the second instance using the method. [!code-csharp[FormatterServices_PopulateObjects#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FormatterServices_PopulateObjects/cs/Populate.cs#1)] [!code-vb[FormatterServices_PopulateObjects#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FormatterServices_PopulateObjects/vb/Populate.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static object GetSafeUninitializedObject (Type type);
.method public static hidebysig object GetSafeUninitializedObject(class System.Type type) cil managed
public: static System::Object ^ GetSafeUninitializedObject(Type ^ type);
static member GetSafeUninitializedObject : Type -> obj

span.span: The type of object to create.

summary.span: 创建指定对象类型的新实例。

span.span: Creates a new instance of the specified object type.
A zeroed object of the specified type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 因为对象的新实例初始化为零，而运行没有构造函数，该对象可能表示由该对象被认为是有效的状态。Because the new instance of the object is initialized to zero and no constructors are run, the object might not represent a state that is regarded as valid by that object. 应仅用于反序列化时用户想要立即填充所有字段。 should only be used for deserialization when the user intends to immediately populate all fields. 它不会创建一个未初始化的字符串，因为创建空的不可变类型没有任何用处。It does not create an uninitialized string, since creating an empty instance of an immutable type serves no purpose. 将为所有类级别[链接需求](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md)到[需求](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e5283e28-2366-4519-b27d-ef5c1ddc1f48)以确保所有直接和间接调用方具有要求指定的权限。 converts all class level [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) to [Demands](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e5283e28-2366-4519-b27d-ef5c1ddc1f48) to ensure that all direct and indirect callers have the permissions that the demand specifies. 使用从部分受信任的源反序列化时增加的安全级别。Use to increase the level of security when deserializing from a partially trusted source. 在完全信任方案中更好的性能，对于使用。For better performance in full trust scenarios, use .

exception.span: 参数为 。

span.span: The parameter is .

exception.span: 参数不是有效的公共语言运行时类型。

span.span: The parameter is not a valid common language runtime type.

exception.span: 调用方没有所要求的权限。

span.span: The caller does not have the required permission.
For providing serialization services.
Associated enumerations: , .

summary.span: 返回特定类的所有可序列化成员。

span.span: Returns all the serializable members for a particular class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] GetSerializableMembers (Type type);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Reflection.MemberInfo[] GetSerializableMembers(class System.Type type) cil managed
public: static cli::array <System::Reflection::MemberInfo ^> ^ GetSerializableMembers(Type ^ type);
static member GetSerializableMembers : Type -> System.Reflection.MemberInfo[]

span.span: The type being serialized.

summary.span: 获取指定 的类的所有可序列化成员。

span.span: Gets all the serializable members for a class of the specified .

returns.span: 非瞬态、非静态成员的 类型的数组。

span.span: An array of type of the non-transient, non-static members.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常情况下，类的可序列化的成员是字段和属性等的非瞬态、 非静态成员。Generally, the serializable members of a class are non-transient, non-static members such as fields and properties. 若要包含，属性必须具有 getter 和 setter。To be included, properties must have both a getter and a setter. 实现的类接口或具有一个序列化代理项不需要将所有这些成员，或可序列化的其他成员。A class that implements the interface or has a serialization surrogate does not have to serialize all these members, or can serialize additional members. 因为`GetSerializableMembers`方法调用方法，它不返回字段按特定顺序，如按字母顺序或按声明顺序。Because the `GetSerializableMembers` method calls the method, it does not return fields in a particular order, such as alphabetical or declaration order. 你的代码必须不依赖于返回字段的顺序。Your code must not depend on the order in which fields are returned. ## Examples 下面的示例调用方法的实现从方法。The following example calls the method from an implementation of method. [!code-cpp[FormatterServices#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FormatterServices/cpp/FormatterServices.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[FormatterServices#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/FormatterServices/CS/FormatterServices.cs#2)]

exception.span: 参数为 。

param.name: type
param.span: 正在序列化或克隆的类型。

span.span: The type being serialized or cloned.
The context where the serialization occurs.

summary.span: 获取属于指定 的类且位于提供的 中的所有可序列化成员。

span.span: Gets all the serializable members for a class of the specified and in the provided .

returns.span: 非瞬态、非静态成员的 类型的数组。

span.span: An array of type of the non-transient, non-static members.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常情况下，类的可序列化的成员是字段和属性等的非瞬态、 非静态成员。Generally, the serializable members of a class are non-transient, non-static members such as fields and properties. 若要包含，属性必须具有 getter 和 setter。To be included, properties must have both a getter and a setter. 实现的类或具有序列化代理项不需要将所有这些成员，或可序列化的其他成员。A class that implements or has a serialization surrogate does not have to serialize all these members, or can serialize additional members. 如果`context`包括枚举值，也包括在暂时性字段此方法返回的数组。If `context` includes the enumeration value, transient fields are also included in the array returned by this method. 因为`GetSerializableMembers`方法调用方法，它不返回字段按特定顺序，如按字母顺序或按声明顺序。Because the `GetSerializableMembers` method calls the method, it does not return fields in a particular order, such as alphabetical or declaration order. 你的代码必须不依赖于返回字段的顺序。Your code must not depend on the order in which fields are returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 因为对象的新实例初始化为零，而运行没有构造函数，该对象可能表示由该对象被认为是有效的状态。Because the new instance of the object is initialized to zero and no constructors are run, the object might not represent a state that is regarded as valid by that object. 当前方法应仅用于反序列化时用户想要立即填充所有字段。The current method should only be used for deserialization when the user intends to immediately populate all fields. 它不会创建一个未初始化的字符串，因为创建空的不可变类型没有任何用处。It does not create an uninitialized string, since creating an empty instance of an immutable type serves no purpose. > [!NOTE] > 不能使用方法来创建派生的类型的实例类。You cannot use the method to create instances of types that derive from the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果中的元素`data`是`null`，不会向该字段写入任何内容。If an element in `data` is `null`, does not write anything to that field. ## Examples 下面的示例创建的 Book 类实例，并在实例上设置字段值。The following example creates an instance of a Book class and sets field values on the instance. 然后，代码获取类型信息使用方法。The code then gets the type information using the method. 代码的实例数据复制到对象数组使用方法。The code copies the instance data into an object array using the method. 使用创建类的新未初始化的实例方法。A new uninitialized instance of the class is created using the method. 最后，第一个实例中的数据复制到第二个实例使用方法。Finally, the data from the first instance is copied into the second instance using the method.
